citations.narrative:
A member of the public was bitten by an African Grey Parrot around the time of inspection. The encounter was not
observed by APHIS officials or by staff of the facility. There was no public barrier in place around the African Grey’s
enclosure, an attendant was not present, and there was no signage on the cage to indicate not to touch the animal
contained within. The risk of injury to the general viewing public or to the animals if there is direct access to animal
enclosures. Public exhibition must be conducted in a manner that utilizes sufficient barriers and/or attendants to minimize
risk of harm to the animals or to the public. Correct by ensuring that there is no direct contact of the public to the animals
without sufficient barriers being in place, or the presence of easily identifiable attendants placed at animal enclosures.
Correct by: November 20, 2023.

There was only one staff member present at the facility during public feeding times to the animals. The public feeding
occurs at multiple locations at the facility. The staff member was in the office attending to the front desk, which left all the
animal areas without supervision. There is concern for risk of injury, inappropriate foods being fed to the animals, and
inappropriate animal handling if there is no attendant present during public feeding encounters. Correct by ensuring there
is a responsible, knowledgeable, and readily identifiable employee or attendant present at all times during public contact.
Correct by: November 20, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
